title: No drug is safe: Drug developers decry Texas abortion pill ruling
description: Over 400 biopharma leaders are calling for the ruling to be reversed.

title: Ex-Twitter CEO who was fired by Musk sues company over unpaid legal expenses
description: Lawsuit: Twitter refuses to reimburse costs related to federal investigations.

description: 13 Star Trek movies are available in 4K, Dolby Vision, and Dolby Atmos.

title: Apple releases last week’s security patches for older iPhones, iPads, and Macs
description: "Actively exploited" security holes were already patched in iOS 16 and macOS 13.

description: Lawsuit: Images were shared "for the tasteless entertainment of Tesla employees."

description: It's a climate sensor and display, automation button, infrared remote, and more.

title: Google is killing third-party Google Assistant smart displays

description: Would you pay $7 to put an "M1 Inside" holographic sticker on your Mac? I might.

title: Tesla price cuts and a tax credit are driving used EV sales
description: The average used EV cost $43,000, a four percent drop year on year.

title: Resident Evil 4’s new paid DLC should have been a free cheat code

description: Apple was defying industry trends a few months ago, but no longer, says IDC.

title: Last-gen ultralight laptops are nearly as fast as new models—and much cheaper
description: Would you pay 42 percent more for a 7.8 percent productivity boost?
